intro: Chaenorhinum formenterae, commonly known as the Formentera horned flower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, horn-like floral structures. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It is a perennial herb that thrives in sunny conditions and is adapted to withstand drought. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
